item.title: [Leetcode] Trim a Binary Search Tree(Medium)
item.description: LeetCode 669 - Trim a Binary Search Tree Given the root of a binary search tree and the lowest and highest boundaries as low and high, trim the tree so that all its elements lies in [low, high]. Trimming the tree should not change the relative structure of the elements that will remain in the tree (i.e., any node’s descendant should remain a descendant). It can be proven that there

item.title: [Leetcode] Search in a Binary Search Tree(Easy)
item.description: LeetCode 700 - Search in a Binary Search Tree You are given the root of a binary search tree (BST) and an integer val. Find the node in the BST that the node’s value equals val and return the subtree rooted with that node. If such a node does not exist, return null. example Input: root = [4,2,7,1,3], val = 2 Output: [2,1,3] Input: root = [4,2,7,1,3], val = 5
